_symbol_format: .TICKER YYMMDD P/C STRIKE  (positive qty = buy, negative = sell)
_source: OptionsKit SPX 7/9 Call Calendar â€” 82.1% win rate, 64% CAGR, $10Kâ†’$60.7K (May 2022 - Dec 2025)
notes: SPX weekly 7/9 call calendar: sell 40Î” call 7 DTE, buy same strike call 9 DTE. Every Wednesday at 3:00 PM.
rationale: Highest CAGR weekly income strategy (64%). 82% win rate over 173 trades. $94 avg profit per lot. Exploit 2-day theta differential on SPX weeklies.

entry_conditions.iv_environment: Works across IV regimes â€” not IV-dependent like diagonals

sell_leg.note: Use exact DTE (7 days). 40 delta call = slightly ITM, higher premium.

buy_leg.note: Same strike as sell leg (calendar = same strike). 9 DTE = 2 days more than short.

entry_conditions.strike_offset: Use exact strike offsets (0 = same strike for calendar)

futures_expiry_awareness.why_wednesday: Wednesday entry gives 7 DTE to next Wednesday SPX expiry (or Friday). SPX has M/W/F expirations.
futures_expiry_awareness.avoid_quarterly_expiry: Skip weeks with quarterly futures expiry (3rd Friday of Mar/Jun/Sep/Dec) â€” unusual gamma and pin risk
futures_expiry_awareness.vix_expiry: VIX expires ~30 days before monthly OpEx (usually a Wednesday) â€” extra volatility that week

entry_conditions.notes: From OptionsKit backtest: SPX 7/9 call calendar. Open every Wednesday at 3 PM. Short 40Î” call 7 DTE, long same-strike call 9 DTE. Profit target 30%. Cap profits. 82% win rate, $94 avg per lot. The 2-day theta edge is the income engine â€” short leg decays faster with less time remaining.

pnl_drivers.max_profit: Value of 9 DTE option minus 7 DTE option at short expiry (typically 30%+ of debit)
pnl_drivers.max_loss: Net debit paid (difference between 9 DTE and 7 DTE option price)
pnl_drivers.primary_driver: Theta differential â€” 7 DTE option decays faster than 9 DTE option (theta curve is non-linear, steeper near expiry)
pnl_drivers.secondary_driver: Price staying near the 40 delta strike â€” max profit when underlying at strike at front expiry

greeks_profile.theta: positive â€” 7 DTE decays faster than 9 DTE, you keep the differential
greeks_profile.vega: slightly positive â€” 9 DTE has marginally more vega, small IV expansion benefit
greeks_profile.delta: near neutral (same strike calendar), slight positive delta from 40Î” call selection
greeks_profile.gamma: short leg has higher gamma â€” risk if SPX moves sharply away from strike

pnl_drivers.ideal_scenario: SPX stays near the 40Î” strike over the week. 7 DTE option decays to near zero, 9 DTE retains some value. Close at 30% profit. Repeat every Wednesday.
